Deserves a little better than the 2 star rating it was currently getting. The food isn't spectacular but it tastes good. Portion size is excellent. They play movies on a flat screen as well. Open air is nice but i found a mosquito near me. Overall a good experience !  I had kungpao chicken.

I'm never disappointed at this place. They've got the basics covered, it's a casual dining room, and it's inexpensive. Granted, you're not going to get a gourmet meal here, but would you expect to in an Ice Cream parlor (and more!)?

Favorites: The turkey burger with cranberry relish, grilled cheese, portabello sandwich. And of course, Ice Cream (though there are better places, ironically, to get ice cream, Italian Ice, gelato, etc. nearby)

I have to laugh at Paige W.'s review! I think this is the only eatery in Philly that my rural parents actually liked...

The worst service I have ever experience at a restaurant. The waiter was rude and slow. He took absolutely forever to bring out our food or even serve us water. The water was disgusting tap water that wasn't even cold. We asked for papad and he said that they can't make any because they are too busy. They weren't busy. Only had two other tables with guest. The naan's came out uncooked and so we asked for them to be cooked or put in the oven longer and he said he couldn't do it because they were busy. I highly recommend not going here. Food and service sucked.

This place was horrible.. We will never eat here again.

Salsa had a white pubic hair and when we told our server he denied that it was a pubic hair & that it was from the onion that they add to salsa.

food not good. tostada was not crunchy, it was saggy and that is not how its suppose to be. 

chile relleno barely did had chile, you cannot even taste chile. it was just ground beef and 2 small piece of chile not like what i'm used to that you can actually see the whole chile stuffed with cheese and meat.

Disappointed. Food okay. Clerks clueless. I got charged for a small cheese pizza in addition to my order by a newbie cashier. When I pointed out the error, a more senior employee suggested she refund the overage in cash. Fine enough but she didn't think to tell her how to cancel the kitchen order. Out comes two pizzas. And she refunded me less than its cost, on review of events. So her cash drawer will be way off and they wasted a small cheese pizza. My suggestion: keep an eye on them, especially if everyone seems to be in training!

This place is nice, breadsticks are on point! Pizza is a three star, blaze and mod are both better but they don't have this atmosphere. Now for the beer, the Boulder shake chocolate porter is my new favorite! Really good, tastes like a chocolate milkshake in beer form. Yummy!

We have two kids attending college in Tucson and have tried breakfast spots all over town. This is our clear favorite. 

First, excellent breakfast cocktails. The mimosa menu alone makes this worth a visit. Second, the food is excellent. My husband loves the Return of the Mac. I prefer the French toast- any of their versions is excellent.  I also love the house made yogurt and granola.

Don't forget to look at the pastry selection!
Hip city ranch with Buffalo sauce hits the spot. It's a bit expensive but not too much on par with other philly spots. Good food n great vibe.

goat cheese and crawfish crepe, ftw!! this was really good and sort of creepy with that crawfish staring back at you when they present the dish. i thoroughly enjoyed this dish. i also got a gorgonzola (to my recollection) tart, which i thought was going to have a crust but did not. it was really rich and was accompanied by apples, blackberries and a syruppy pecan concoction (very Nola) that was overly sweet. i recommend going solely for the crawfish crepe.
Good place to grab some pizza and sandwiches. Got right in on a Saturday night and service was good. 3 Floyds on tap.

Burger Republic is a good choice for a casual meal! Their burgers aren't my favorite in Nashville, but they're still certainly worth ordering. You can't leave without ordering a milkshake though! That's where BR really shines.

Great all around!!! The food was phenomenal and the service was second to none.  When we first showed up I instantly thought there was no way we were going to get seated right away and would have at least a hour wait because the parking lot was packed.  

This place isn't cheap so if you are trying to go out for a quick bite to eat with the family this is not your place.  If you are going out for a special day with your family this is a great place to go.  They have a decent sized kids menu and the kids food is great.  We went for a later dinner and I think the waitress could tell our kids were ready for their food.  As a result of that the kids food came out in less that 10 minutes and was delicious.  

To top it all off this place has the best military discount I have ever seen.  If you are in the military and show your ID card you get 15% off.

I have not been here in a long time and decided to go the other day. The beer and burger were good. Bartender daytime service was good and friendly. I must say some bartenders act like they could not care if you were there or not. At least she was friendly and sociable good for her.

Bhature. It's bread that they fry. Fried bread. FRIED BREAD. It happens to be absolutely delicious, too. Their other breads [naan, kulcha, etc] were good and to standards you'd expect from a good Indian restaurant. But that goddamn Bhature, I'll have that all day.

Let me first say that it's very nice inside, feels upscale and is definitely a nice place to take someone out on a date. They even play Bollywood flicks on the TV there, great distraction if the date starts talking about the Kardashians or her ex, so just lose yourself in the food and 100 people dancing on the screen.

Opened up with the Pakoda, and having been craving it since I last been to Zaika, it hit the spot. A plate of it is perfect for four, a bit overwhelming for two. Since I'm an eternal fatass, I polished it off, but it didn't leave much room for the dinner...

WHICH WAS INCREDIBLE. It was the Paneer Bhurji, and it will go down as one of the most tasty items I've ever had at any Indian joint. The waitress asked what level of hot I wanted it at, and I foolishly said 10 at first, but quickly revised it to a 7 when I saw her next. The lady friend insisted a 5 was intolerable last time she ate here, so I moved the heat index accordingly from my understanding of her tolerance.

Good move, the curry made me sweat, but didn't break me. BEAST MODE MOTHERFUCKERS. The great thing about food from this region is how exotic it is in comparison to the foods we eat here everyday, so it's a real treat when they take so much care in its preparation and the outcome is as bangin' as my dinner was.

The place is entirely vegetarian, so the dish consisted of grated cheese, onions, and bell pepper with their special dash of spices in a curry. Wholly unexpected was the awesome dish placed in front of me, and staring down a dish of rice [it's included] and a whole basket of nom-tastic Indian breads. Having stuffed myself on the Pakoda, I had to force myself to eat the spicy dish until my stomach called it quits. Not sure if it was from the peppery goodness or just telling me that one man should not consume more than a couple pounds of food in a single sitting.

Long and wordy, but you honestly just look at that star rating, and for there not being a lick of meat in the building, this place was unbelievably good.
Waitress was horrible. Steak and veggis were cold. Usually the restaurant is a pleasant experience. This time around, not so much. Inconsistent.
I ordered potato green cassava leaf and okra sauce the food wasn't good @ all I've had much better I drove a half hour because of the reviews the food is awful

Service was great. Dawn took care of us and she was super attentive to our needs, bright-eyed-and-bushy-tailed she started our morning of right.

You had me at Eggs Benedict! Say what it's made in a New Orleans style with Andouille Sausage! Bonus Points! Loved it! 

The coffee was okay...but I like a stronger brew.

Monday Morning at 6 A.M. we were the only table. I love the early start time because my Dad and I can have breakfast before I go into work at 7. Bob Evan's and other popular breakfast business meeting spots tend to have that 6 A.M. rush. If you're looking for something just off Keystone and close to the office and able to get in right at 6 this is your place. 

5 Stars for the great start time and friendly service. The food was 4 stars, nothing that was floored by but I did like the selection and the service and proximity gave me that last star.

Meh, the pizza was underwhelming and relatively expensive for the small size I got. They only offer three sizes, small, large and extra large (new size just introduced) but the small for around $18 was not worth the money. The thin crust was crunchy, had a light blackened taste - it was good. But the tomato sauce was too sweet and the pepperonis were kinda soggy. The small size pizza was smaller than I'd expect for the price as well.

I ordered the Half Rack Ribs with Corn Bread and Mashed Potatoes. Ribs are very chewy and dry. The Corn Bread and Mashed Potatoes are both very good. Fired Up BBQ is better. Will only come back here for the Corn Bread and Mashed Potatoes.

The service was EXCELLENT! Jessica served us and she is wonderful. This location does not serve pizza like some of the other ones but it was okay. We liked Jessica so much we stayed anyways. I had the Bullys Dip.  It was to die for. The place is great. I highly recommend!

Went here for Brunch on a Saturday around 12pm. No wait for a table for 5, but I don't understand why. This place was great! We got eggs benedict, french toast, omelettes, and everyone really enjoyed their food. I thought the bloody marys were really good. The service was excellent. Our server was very friendly and accommodating, talkative but not overpowering, and just very cheerful. Prices were great. I would definitely come back here next time I'm in the area.

Wonderful place to go for lunch.  The lunch buffet is tremendous with lots of light salads and grilled options and heavier fare if you want.  Limited but good selection of craft beers and wine by the glass.  Sit outside if the weather is nice.  Service is good. Will be back.

I normally don't write reviews for chains, but the service at this Blaze is always incredible, everyone's so happy and accommodating even when there are large crowds. It's also an unbeatable price for a meal that will definitely fill you up.

Hidden gem!  I recommend trying.

The food here is really good.  Their dishes are different from most other places around and they use ingredients that are creative.....usually a reflection of a good chef.  

It has indoor and outdoor seating, we sat outside as we brought our little dog which they allow there.  The outdoor area is a bit small, but seemed to be much bigger inside if you want to be seated sooner.

Really cute place

Fantastic cheesesteaks in a quaint little shop. I usually drive a little out of the way when visiting my boyfriend's parents just to go here. Because its small, it can get a little packed at times. The milkshakes here are the best. I recommend trying their shake of the month, even though they might sound a little crazy at first, the flavors are never overwhelming, and they always manage to make it work. I've had the privilege of trying their cotton candy milkshake and their candy cane milkshake, both did not disappoint.

I've gotten takeout breakfasts from The Egg & I on several occasions and have always enjoyed them. I've always gone with the Two Egg Breakfast, which comes with an English Muffin, your choice of breakfast meat, and potatoes -- the eggs have always been perfectly prepared and the meal very satisfying.

Definitely worth a look for a breakfast if in you're in the area.
Wow!  Maybe the best breakfast in Tucson! Great service!  Best cup of strong, smooth coffee!

BANGIN mac n cheese.
delicious ice cream.
crafty baked goods on the menu.

sexually ambiguous waitstaff -- my favorite kind.

when they opened, they showed promise. that was then, now is now. There was a hair in my soup, they made light of it, BIG Mistake. No matter the time of day or day o the week; i a handicapped man has to make a looong trek to the back of the house to be seated. There is nothing you can purchase here that is not done better elsewhere. Arbys Roast Beef makes a better Sandwich!
as i said they showed promise, we came back for items that sent us over the moon; what we got on our return visit was 'mooned'!
we can not recommend, and we do not even think of ever returning.
our last visit was sometime last year, if there have been any changes...we do not
know of it and do not care.

Yum! Mussels are excellent---get extra bread for dipping. Order small plates and share to try lots if items. Kale salad is very good but a small is enough for two people to share since the flavors are unique --- good balance among Parmesan, citrus and cranberries. Guacamole is indeed yummy and lobster hush puppies are a great twist on soul food. Jalapeño ketchup has a nice kick. Shortrib tacos are good, dependable food. They won't knock your socks off, but you won't be sorry. Drinks: 1920 is a little more bitter than I anticipated, but still good. Existentialist is very refreshing as a summer drink.
Great food, sweet people. Long wait on a Fri Sat nights tho. Fun little place to hang with peeps!

Would I rate this higher than my city's famed donut store- Blue Star Donuts? YES. 

Would I prefer District than most of the donut stores I've been too? YES.

They have breakfast options. They have a bar area. This is besides their novelty/ fancy donuts and coffee. What more can you ask for?

Oh SPACE! They have tons of space for patrons. It's not just a "here's your food and be gone" establishment. They have amazing artwork hung along their industrial wall.

If you go, try their Croque Madame! Hint: It's not bagel. It's a donut!

As a vegetarian, it's not always super easy to find quality fast food, but b. good does a fantastic job! I love their veggie burgers, salads and kale/quinoa bowls. I look forward to their apple pie milkshake every fall. Their sweet potato fries are fantastic. My only complaint is that sometimes the service there leaves much to be desired. I work across the street and get an hour for lunch, and there have been times when it hasn't even been busy but it's taken almost my entire lunch break to get our food. The quality and freshness have always been great at least!

Awesome . Food was fantastic. Beautiful waterfront restaurant and just completely elegant. Worth the price for a place of this caliber[18-30].  Drinks were not bad. I suggest Long Island Iced Teas. They are about 8 and they make them strong. The service was impeccable as well and very friendly and professional. You do not see that , that much anymore. We are not brunch people . We believe that it is more upscale to be served. I definitely suggest going when you can veer off the brunch .. Meaning other than Sunday afternoon. Oh and by the way, the bar is fancy as well and fine just to relax and have a few.

This place is delish!  

We ate here on a Sunday for lunch after touring Fonthill mansion.  Picked it based on the great yelp! reviews, and it was as good as others said!

The quesadilla that I had (anita's?) was probably the best quesadilla I ever have eaten. Filled with pulled pork, avocado, and cheese, absolutely yummy! My husband loved his cubano sandwich.

Service was friendly and prompt. Order and pay at the counter, then food is brought to your table.

Highly recommend, and I would return if in the area again!

So, here we are, six weeks after my review and a response from the franchise owner that I will be contacted by management...NOTHING.  Same response and cycle my first complaint last year..."oh, I'm so sorry for your experience, I'll have a manager contact you very soon"...yeah, right.  Walking by your establishment 2-3 times a week, I now flip you off while passing...

This was one of the best meals I've had in New Orleans, which, considering most things in this town are covered in butter and deliciousness, says a lot. In particular, I usually dislike BBQ Shrimp but that dish is really fantastic here. The sauce is unreal and there is definitely a reason it's their signature dish.

The burgers are the best and I love the sweet potato chips. It's a little pricey but has a fun, laid back atmosphere and good music. I like the out doorsy feel and tikki bar. Unfortunately, was here during my work hours and couldn't try one of their fun drinks.
Great space! Not a big place so prepare to sit st the bar but the wait is worth it. Food is amazing!
Raw oysters were monsters and the jambalaya was the best I've ever had!  Highly recommended!

Ordered from Pizzarella a few times. My favorite thing is the Penne Pasta with Eggplant on top. his is not a menu item, but something they are willing to do, and it's delicious and a HUGE portion! The staff has always been pleasant on the phone, the delivery guy Scott is a gem, and they were SUPER nice when I went in to eat there. Very accomodating! All in all, I've never had a bad experience or tasted something from here that I didn't like. I highly recommend them, both for delivery or eating there!

Great service and great authentic food!  I ordered the hummus of course and combo kabob (chicken & lamb)....comes with rice and a small salad....very tasty!  Would recommend this restaurant for sure!  Don't forget the Turkish coffee

Everything here is usually delicious. However I got the kale salad for the first time to try their salad period I would not recommend it. It is $14 with chicken on it. So very small salad and the chicken has no flavor. Everything else on the menu is delicious and reasonably priced . I just had it better expectations the cause the girl take him out holder said it was one of her favorites.
Amazing food!! Consistently good food- fresh and original- found this spot on here and all the reviews were right! Definitely would recommend.

Another disappointing meal. Gullifty's used to be our go-to restaurant for lunch and dinner. We came twice recently after probably a year or two. One of our favorites was fajitas so, having a hankering today we came in. The place wasn't too busy and we were seated right away and taken good care of by Jon. We ordered the fish tacos and shrimp fajitas. The tacos were okay, but the fish was a little soggy and not hot. The fajitas tasted okay, but nothing like we remembered. The jumbo shrimp (6) really didn't fill any one up. Crossing this place off our list.

The most disappointing Chik Fil A experience I have ever had. Typically they have a very eager service team and a very clean setting. However, this location was the opposite of "normal" on all accounts. The managers were expressing their displeasure with the staff and their day in front of the line of customers waiting to be helped. The dining room had 10 tables available, only 2 of which were clean. The manager snapped at an employee in front of all of us. Just disrespectful and dirty. The highlight of our trip was an employee named Kyle, he embodied the Chik Fil A culture.

cafe fleur de lis has a simply amazing breakfast menu.  the everything hashbrowns were heart attack heaven!  gravy, cheese, bacon, sausage, ham... mmmmmmmmmm mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
the fleur de lis omelette was divine... tres magnifique! crawfish, peppers, cheese... bliss folded into fluffy eggs!

I love this location on the river sitting outside and the place inside too
It's always pretty good  as far as food and service go and a fun atmosphere. High energy and unique in terms of the d.j. That may or may not regularly be there but he was while we were and it was quite a spectacle. 
Also, Hands down Best crab in town.
Empty on a Wednesday at 6. Love the sweet bartenders. And frozen drinks come with a floater. Yum!

Used to be a favorite weekend stop, but haven't been in a while. Service was lacking. we paid for our food and went to get a cup of coffee, surprised to see that 3 of 4 pots were completely empty. once we let them know, they reacted quickly, but glasses for water were gone too.. wish they would have noticed. specialty coffee came after breakfast, in a paper cup. Just not what we expected from Rembrandt's.
Their paninis are great. And they have one of the few salads I eat! They also have an adorable hodge podge of tables in the yard out back. Great on a sunny day!
Delicious brunch food. Very good brunch food and drinks. I really liked the bloody mary. Service was excellent and the atmosphere/ambience was very clean and nice. I plan on going back soon.
We have a New Good Eating place in Town! Super Recommended Latin Food!  Recomendable al 100% lo mejor en Comida Latina en el Area

Went there for lunch with a friend. We ordered their bruschetta and portobello mushroom sandwich. Even though they've changed their menu and didn't have that sandwich anymore on their menu, they were still able to make it. The bruschetta was very good but they overheated both sandwiches. Overall, service was good and we'll visit again.

I ate here once with my boyfriend and I was pretty un-impressed. the bbq was ok, definitely not the best, but not the worst either. to be honest the low stars is mainly due to the bathrooms. I went in with a horrible cold barely being able to smell but the womens restroom was filthy and had a horrible stench. Not just like regular bathroom stench, but moldy water smell. I felt like I could barely breathe. haven't gone back since but not totally opposed to giving it a second try.

This place is absolutely phenomenal!! I wish i lived closer or hope I am back here again in the area so I can come back. The fresh pasta is off the charts good as was the sauce. Even the bread to start the meal was great!! Food came out very fast and service was top notch! Wish I could give more than 5 stars!

This place is unassuming. A little more modernized than your local NOLA hole-in-the-wall.

What We Ordered: the most savory, tasty brussel sprouts ever. Order them - you won't regret it.
The mussels. Above average. Good buttery broth.
Seafood Gumbo - so tasty. Great flavors and consistency. Not overly salted. It was my boyfriends first gumbo experience... He wanted to lick that plate so bad.

Service was friendly. Hostesses were charming. Cool, laid back atmosphere geared towards the older crowd.

I have been several times and recommended to visitors.  Everybody has been very pleased.  I am a foodie from the East and Europe and was quite surprised by the quality of the food and the freshness.  I very rarely eat fried food but was totally happy with the pakoras (spinach and vegetable).  It was apparent that they had just been made and the chickpea flour covering was a tasty combination of crunch and chewiness.  With our guests they were gone in a heartbeat.  We had several curries, mostly lamb and chicken as well as naan and papadam.  A nice assortment of well priced Indian and other beers to match.  Friendly, knowledgeable and efficient service.  I think they are seeing the success they well deserve.

First off, I have a for sure, right on crush on Chef John Besh, so of course I was in love with this place.  Luke was fabulous and yummy. No wait time, service was prompt and friendly.  Great setup in this restaurant, I had a chance to eat in the back room where I could see throw a glass preparing the food, which I extremely enjoyed and made me want to be a chef for a moment at least. 

Then the food came out, mmmm. I went for lunch and I had a Pressed Sandwich of Whole Roast "cochon de lait". This is probably the best cochon de lait I ever had! It came with house-made fries, which I couldn't stop eating. They were addictive! Thankfully they weren't unlimited because I probably would have turned into a fries.

I treated myself to a cocktail, The St.Charles Streetcar. It was St Germaine, Pear Vodka and Champagne. First off, no drink could go wrong with St. Germaine, but add in pear vodka and you have one of those situations that make you want to start singing Janet Jackson... or maybe that part is just me.

Truly enjoyed myself here! You definitely should check out.

This guy at fiesta lanes is a big doosh! He keeps checking on us to make sure our shoes are on and they are. He keeps checking on us and making us feel uncomfortable.  If you want a babysitter to watch you and watch your every move this is the place to go.
This place was everything I needed to comfort my southern heart. The food was amazing & the atmosphere was really cool!

I stayed here for a conference across the street. Let me start by saying my worst experience was ONLY during breakfast. 

Wow! The food here is unbelievable amazing and the biscuits and gravy for breakfast are great unless you would like your eggs scrambled!!!!!!! I was told by the guy making my coffee that it wouldn't be as pretty of a dish by having them scrambled... I waited for a "Bazinga" but the guy was very serious. I spent about ten minutes not try to lose my $&@& and we finally were able to resolve the pretty-ness of my breakfast and I got scrambled. The food arrives and I am blown away by how good it tastes (even though my eggs were scrambled!) 

Day 2: I walk down stairs ready for breakfast and I opt for the hash of the day, of course it has egg in the description and sure enough... "It ONLY comes fried or over easy" said the other guy making my coffee. Once again I try not to lose my $&@& but this guy just wouldn't give up. I was able to connivence him to go back to the 'line cooks' and beg them to please find a soft spot in there heart to make my eggs scrambled... They were able to and I will forever be in their gratitude because this is the best. hash. ever. 

My two cents... If the customer asks for a variation of a freaking egg... Don't tell the person paying your bills that you, "don't like" to do it that way! It's an egg!!!!

Went there for restaurant week, I felt like I was being rushed out, we weren't even done our desserts and the waiter brings us the check. I would think for a steak place that they would know how to cook a steak to order but that is not the case. The best part was the dessert. Wish I could say that I would be back but I don't think that is going to happen.

A great little Italian BYOB place! I went with a date for Valentine's Day, and even though we were a little late for our reservation, they still sat and served us quickly.  It's such a quaint little place. I felt like I was in Italy. I had the fettuccini bolognese, which was in a nice creamy red sauce. It was delicious- the noodles themselves were so good!, and there was enough for leftovers. The only complaint I have is that the tables were extremely close together. I'm talking sharing salt and pepper with the table next to us, tight. Maybe they squeezed in extra tables for Valentine's Day? Whatever the case, it would have been nice to have some wiggle room. Overall, it was a really nice experience!

The New Orleans Kappa Delta Alumnae Association held its annual Founder's Day Dinner at Andrea's last night, and it couldn't have been better.  The food, service and hospitality were top notch.  Planning the event with Tia was quick and efficient.  I would definitely host an event here again.
Took my Mom when she came for a visit, very impressed. Delicious food impeccable service and a great view. Only downside was, it got a bit loud, hence the 4 stars.

Walking down the street to where the Prohibition Taproom is located, I was reminded of the movie Judgement Night, which starred Emilio Estevez and his crew of suburbanite friends who after witnessing a murder, proceed to get stalked down the darkest alleyways of the inner-city. As I approached building, I wondered when I was going to see a trashcan fire, to make the scene complete. 

All of my uneasiness was quickly washed away, however, within minutes of walking inside. The two bartenders (who's names escape me, due to the admirable way they made our drinks) were excellent, and went often out of their way to make a good time out of a slow night.

Prohibition Taproom is a great off-the-beaten-path bar that can easily find it's way onto your list of bars that you like to frequent in the city.

I've been a little slow to post Yelp reviews lately, but giving this place a 5-star rating was a high priority. We arrived early in Tampa and had to kill some time before we could board our cruise ship. We had a delicious breakfast at Pop N Sons and they were nice enough to let us hang out at our table since it wasn't a particularly busy day. The wait staff was fantastic and friendly. Highly recommend this place for breakfast!

I decided to try someplace new for lunch and after perusing Yelp and then navigating through the confusing parking lot of high end shops  that make up Eagle Village we arrived at the Silverspoon.

We started with the truffled fries - they were good, a bit overcooked and probably not an ideal first course as they left me with a bit of a "grease stomach"  - also the cheese mostly overpowered the subtle truffle oil flavor which was fine but not what I was going for when ordering them.

My dining partner had the Farmers Omelette of tasty ham and cheese and veggies which he enjoyed, he especially liked the potatoes served with it. I had a salad - the poached shrimp on baby lettuce and it was also good, perhaps a bit sparse but fine.  We shared a pear tart that was a tiny bit dry but had a yummy vanilla sauce served with it.  

Maybe dinner is a different story but this seems like a great place for "ladies who lunch". The service was good and the food was all okay and the place was cute - the prices seemed a tad high for what it was but that reflects the location.

We came here on a Sunday to grab some lunch after a morning at the dog park. There was only one other family there. The staff was a little disconnected and didn't seem interested in helping us. The only drinks she offered me were in a case with water, naked juice and Gatorade. Not much of a selection. Our food was pretty good but the service and dynamic of the people working there was weird and unwelcoming. The food was good enough but I felt uncomfortable being there.

Really good brunch/dinner spot. Beware- you will wait FOREVER on the weekends. The lines are always insane.

They have live bands on some of the nights- again, sometimes hard to get a seat, but if you do- that's always a plus. There is a cover charge for some of the shows.

Brunch is always pretty good- they have a buffet-style eat all you want thing they do on  Sat/Sun mornings. Buffets usually weird me out, but they do offer a regular brunch menu. Food is great- they have a wide selection of food. My go-to is the Country Grilled platter.

It's a good sign that it's busy- usually on the weekdays it's not quite so packed.

Great place to grab some food. Their eggs Benedict Arnold is great and very filling. The wait was about 15 min on a Tuesday morning so not bad. If you sit on the porch do so before 10am as it heats up a lot outside. Lastly while we waited to be seated they brought us coffee. The place doesn't look like much but the service and food will definitely make up for the small restaurant. Also conveniently located.
The burgers were o.k. It was a little pricey too. We got one of the specialty beers on the place mat and liked that quite a bit. I probably wouldn't go back. It was just o.k.
This place was fantastic. I had the banh mi lemongrass chicken sandwich which was great. My wife had the everything Pho and it was even better. Great cold green tea. Happy, friendly staff.

This place is funky and weird and awesome.  I went in for brunch and got the hangover cure tacos, sloppy Joe meat, eggs, pico, & pimento (?) cheese; and a Cel-ray  (Celery flavor) soda.  Some of my co-workers are regulars, and I'll be back and bring friends.

I've never written a review before, but I have to give Nirvana the props it deserves. I've been to both the lunch buffet and dinner and I've never had a bad meal here. The food is full of flavor and the spice is amazing. I love that they ask your spice preference. Gobi manchurian and samosas are delicious. I've had several of the lamb dishes and they were all phenomenal, my favorite being the lamb roganjosh. Chicken Tikka masala was great; the reviewer who commented it had weird veggies in it must have gotten the wrong dish because I've had it several times here and have no clue what she's talking about. Service is awesome; they started recognizing us after our third visit. The servers are great at helping you navigate the menu and picking out the dishes they find to be most flavorful. This restaurant is amazing!!!

Breakfast visit and wish I could report back EPIC stuff but alas I cannot. Makes me sad sharing that a $30+ breakfast just didn't hit the spot for TWO people. What the heck!?

First, the artichoke and ham omelet for nearly $11 is a massive disappointment. Not much of an omelette and was served with 2 sourdough toasts that quite frankly tasted a little (just a little) better than the omelette. The cheese was partially melted in the omelette...seriously, that's a big no no. The artichoke was alright and the ham wasn't great... 

The granola pancakes were tasty but not fluffy and LOTS of air holes. You get 4 thin ones for roughly $11.

We were asked if "bottomless coffee" was what we wanted and of course that sounds awesome, right? Well...skip it. Cause for nearly $3.50+ you're just paying for unlimited refills which doesn't make much sense considering EVERYWHERE ELSE let's you get bottomless coffee for under $2.50 or thereabouts. We had to ask for milk since they don't keep that at the coffee bar.

Service is meh...they are somewhat friendly at the bar but there's no table service and it feels awkward if they clean the table or if you're supposed to do it...however they don't mind asking for a tip when you pay for your order. Also? They give you a NUMBER. It's a stand that has a number and you take it to your table. They should try to adopt what Chick-fil-a has and go with colors or what Mud House does with animal faces. I don't know, something better than a NUMBER. 

Will I be back? Probably...but when there's other choices nearby...you know.

Very nice place to eat. I had the blackened catfish which was the best I've had. Service was excellent although our waitress had a bit of attitude. I figured out why when we received our bill and her 20% gratuity was already included so her attitude didn't effect her tip. I definately would eat there again however. It's a fun atmosphere.

We went to the District on New Years Eve. We made sure to call ahead and booked it over there on the bus just in time to try their food that was recommended by a friend. It did not disappoint. Their location reminded us of Portland, OR. I had the chicken slider -- it was okay, not out of this world. But, what is out-of-this-world are their donuts! We bought 3 to have champagne and donuts to ring in the new year and they were amazing. As we were walking out of the restaurant we were talking to the manager and he gave us 4 more for free (they had already closed)! 

On NYE, we were able to cut the donuts into 6 slices (yes, they're THAT big), so everyone could try some of each. By far, the egg nog was our favorite... then the Chunky Monkey. The one's with no filling or icing were a little dryer, but still quite good. These aren't you're typical greasy donuts, they're fluffy and yummy.

My partner and his mom really loved their sliders (see photos) and we all LOVED their salad! I would go back to just have their salad and donuts. 

We would recommend this place to anyone coming into town. It is a little pricey, but the food and how they work with charities is amazing. So, eat local!

This is an older hotel that needs updating badly.  We stayed for 4 nights in a non-smoking room on the first floor facing the marina.  The other rooms around us were obviously smoking rooms as each time we left the room we were overwhelmed with smoke.  The beds were the best part as they were wonderful.  The TV was small and the cable kept fading in and out of service.  The small refrigerator was a nice addition and a microwave would have been nice.  The coffee maker would only make 1 cup at a time and they were very small cups of weak coffee.  There is not any counter space in the bathroom to set things on.  When taking a shower, the water would be perfect and then would turn really hot and then go cold like someone flushed a toilet.  There is not a pool here.  The best time to go to the casino is in the morning as it becomes very smoky from cigarettes later in the afternoon and the ventilation is poor.  I had great service at the registration desk and all the employees were very nice. This hotel is very dog friendly and has an area outside the hotel designated for pets with poop bags.  (first time I have seen this at any hotel.) The hotel room maintenance team did a great job.  The Marina is really nice and a great place to walk or jog. It is very dog friendly with a fairly large secure dog park where they can run free and get some exercise.  I think I would probably choose a different hotel next time.
Nice place with a friendly staff. Good is good but not great. Rotisserie chicken is a little on the dry side. Tri tip is great with a good smoke flavor.

My experience at Luke's was great. From the service to the food and the ambience. I ended up trying the Luke's burger and it was 5/5. I also tried there Bloody Mary 4/5. Finally, it was pleasant to know they serve Blantons Bourbon.

I have been somewhat of a regular at Sushi Haru for the past year. Well, tonight they lost my business forever. I ordered the tempura japenese bagel, which I always ordered. I also ordered a Mexican roll and a gator roll. The tempura roll tasted bad,  as if the oil it had been cooked in was old. I had 1 piece  and didn't eat anymore if it. The waitress/owner never came back to the table after the food was served. She didn't even refill my water glass, which sucked because that was all I was drinking. Once my friend and I had finished eating she came over to take our plates which still had a few pieces of the other rolls on them. I told her to please don't get mad, but the tempura roll tasted bad. At that point she became hostile towards us. She said it was popular and I agreed but that tonight it did not taste good. I said I'd like a box for the few other pieces and if we could get our check.  she said she would not give us a box because it was happy hour. Then she said if she was going to give me a box then she was going to go ahead and charge me for the uneaten  sushi roll that I told her did not taste good. I wasn't planning on taking it anyway.  I have never been treated so rudely at a restaurant that I frequent often by someone who is the owner. She lost a good customer over $3! By the way, the food isn't that good anyway. Was just a convenient spot to get in and out of because they never have any customers.

I love that they have recently incorporated the console at the table. You can play games, order drinks, and even order desert through this tool, and of course pay your bill (if using a card). You cannot place your meal order, still need to do that through the server, but it's great when you need another beverage and the server is off helping others.
I have had the chili mango tilapia the last couple visits and it has been great each time. It has quite a bit of kick to it and I love it. It comes with the cilantro lime rice, but I'm not a fan of that so I usually ask for double veggie instead.
My daughter is a fan of the classic rib plate with french fries.
The entire family loves the Texas Cheese fries. the fries are topped with cheese,  bacon, green onion and jalepenos. this is my favorite appetizer.
As for deserts, the cookie/icecream combo is very tasty. the cheesecake does taste a bit frozen, but it is a good size portion for sharing and the strawberry sauce is very tasty.
The service is good each time we visit.
Service was very good. Decor and atmosphere is very nice. Drinks and apps were great. I was disappointed in the quality of the filet that I had. It was very fatty.

I honestly love this place. Their food has always been on point. Served hot and ready. Their pasta is delicious. Our server was the biggest sweetheart. I don't see how it could be hated. All of the vegetables and cheese that was served was amazingly fresh. If I could give this place more stars I would.

Gotta tell you, Bellacinos used to be one of our faves, but this Reuben Grinder is pretty pathetic. Very little meat at all, not even much sauerkraut.....mostly bread and some cheese. We skipped Noodles and Co next door to come here....won't make that mistake again. Two hald grinders with this sad amount of meat, a bag of chips, and two drinks set us back almost 20.00. Def not worth the price of a Grinder if they are this skimpy (not to mention what little meat I had on the Reuben was charred all around the edges!)

I wanted to like this place a lot, but it just didn't happen this time. I am hoping that I can give them another try, because I am a burger fanatic and would love to enjoy a good non-McDonald's burger every once in a while. I came here around 9:30 PM and ordered a double Trenton burger with ketchup, mayonnaise, pickles, and raw onions, along with fries and an Oreo milkshake. The milkshake was decently good. There were too many fries and they were a tad on the dark side for me. There needs to be a good fry-to-burger ratio, in my opinion, when ordering a burger and fries. What am I gonna do with a whole bunch of fries after I'm done my burger? I wish they'd charge less and give less fries. On to the $9 burger. It was okay but fell short in so many ways, and that's ultimately why this place only gets 3 stars. It seemed to lack seasoning as there was little taste to the burger. The bottom bun had also gotten soggy and flat from the other ingredients and sort of fell apart in my hand as I was grasping the burger. For whatever reason, the pork roll didn't add much to the already unseasoned burger. Would've maybe been better if there were two pork rolls on the double burger, and if the beef patties were seasoned more thoroughly with at least salt and pepper. I could not even taste salt, at all. I wanted to fall in love with the burger so badly, but the lack of flavor each time I took a bite was just so disheartening. I'd like to give this place a try when I'm having another cheat meal in a week or two! I hope my next experience will be better and that this was just a one-off.
I love the fresh food and flavor of this place.  Nice, interesting concept.  Lots of vegetarian and gluten free options!  Parking is a challenge, but the food and service are worth the walk!
The food was absolutely the best food I have had in Doylestown! Our waiter was very kind and made our experience such a pleasant one. Overall wonderful and I will be back for more.

I was very happy with our first trip to City BBQ! I had a beef brisket sandwich with fries and Mac n cheese. Delicious! I'm not a big meat and BBQ fan generally buy I really enjoyed my lunch today. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant itself was something different!

My company just hosted an event and had chosen  AJ's to cater. The food was delicious, the service was awesome, and the catering staff went above and beyond to make sure everything go smoothly. Their professional set up was second to none. We will continue to use AJ's for our future events.

Because our week started sort of crappy, some family & friends & I decided to treat ourselves to In Riva on Saturday 3/16 (despite the snow/sleet/rain concoction that flared up as soon as we got on the road). Thank goodness the great food made the semi-treacherous drive worthwhile.

We started with the Salumi (cannot recall which 3 we selected!) which was pretty tasty, especially the little pickled pearl onions.  We also tried the Pepperonata which was FABULOUS, the Crispy Chicken Wings (I didn't try but my mates said they were good) and the Mommy's Meatballs.  Everyone ordered pizza as the entree.  Two of us had the Polpette Diavolo - Excellent, one had the Pepperoni (again, cannot recall if there was another name to it) - Delicious, and one had the Potato and Gorgonzola.  Oh my goodness.  That could have quite possibly been the best pizza I've ever tasted.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, Art (chef) is a doll and Toni (hostess/manager) could not have been sweeter.  Our server (I think her name is Jenny) was knowledgable, friendly, and attentive without hovering or smothering.

We are DEFINITELY giving In Riva another visit in the not too distant future.

I want to preface this with the fact that this place is brand new. I think they have a lot of kinks to work out, but there's definite potential, and I'll try them again once they've settled some. 

Food: the food was decent. We got snow crab and shrimp, with the Whole She'bang flavor, in XXX spice. I love spicy food, and I'll say their hot definitely had some spice to it. I may get 3 stars next time, instead of 4, just to taste more of the flavor, but the XXX was hot to the point of just heat. The crab was definitely better than the shrimp. The shrimp they use for the headless is a lot smaller than the shrimp for the head on. (Yes, I realize it'll be smaller without the head, but they seem to actually use different shrimp.)  My friend ordered it with heads on. The shrimp seemed a lot fresher, in addition to being larger. I had headless, and some of them were pretty mushy, and generally just not great. My friend ordered a side of Cajun fries, and it was hard to tell there was any "Cajun" to it. There were a couple of fries with some seasoning on them, but literally just a few. Friend tried to order beer, but they said they don't have a liquor license. Ok, that's fine. I tried to order soda, they said they didn't have that yet either. So, they're menu is still in work. 

Service: this is really what knocked the stars down. The hostess and the manager (I think he was the manager?) were really nice. The other folks sometimes seemed bothered to be asked for anything, and seemed pretty overwhelmed. We had to repeat our order 3 times, and we didn't get anything crazy. We watched as they consistently delivered food to the wrong tables. They even took my drink back to refill, and took it to another table and left it there. When I mentioned that, the server said "oh, I'll just get you another water, it's fine" missing the point that the cup I had been drinking out of was given to another customer. I got up and went and got my drink from the other table, but it was weird. 

Overall, this place definitely has potential. I've gone to similar style places throughout the country, so I do have somewhat high standards. The Mad Crab was more expensive and the quality wasn't quite what it's been at other places, but I also realize we're in the middle of St Louis, but overall food-wise, I would probably give it a 3-3.5. The service knocked them back, but, I'm sure once they get more established, it'll get better.

OMG.....THEY ARE OFFICIALLY CLOSED. Wanted to go today, walked by and was soo dissappointed. Sigh


Soups, salads, and sandwiches! Perfect spot for a quick lunch. Place looks clean and well kept. Menu has plenty of choices for anyone.

I ordered broccoli and cheddar soup with a half croissant chicken sandwich. The soup was oh so delicious! The croissant was good too, but it felt like it was missing something bc it was a lil bit on the drier side. The size they give you for lunch is perfect! Not so heavy that you are returning to work and wanna pass out. lol. Next time I go, I will get a salad. So many salads were ordered while I was eating and they all looked soooooo delicious!

Another plus...they take level up. If you don't have level up yet, go there, download the app, and scan the code to get $5 off! :-)

This is my favorite breakfast place in nice weather!! They'll make you anything you want ...food is fresh and healthy!  As a bonus, I often run into some of my favorite people here.  So happy it's just a few blocks from my house!

Ordered a grilled ham and cheese.
Food showed up without the ham so sent back to the kitchen.  5 mins later, food shows back up.
The cook peeled the grilled cheese open, slapped ham on it and sent the meal back soggy and with cold fries.

WTF??

Bully's has lost my business for a while.....

Filipiniana is a middle of the road experience for me. I've been there twice now, and tried the shaved ice dessert (not the giant halo halo), the purple ube cake, and a couple of the drinks. The drinks are pretty average (thai tea and iced coffee), nothing special. The shaved ice was an experience - the first time I had it I had it with the red beans and wasn't crazy about it. The second time I nixed the beans and added some extra fruit. I was hoping for strawberries, but the guy serving me said they needed to be tossed, and I ended up with pineapple pieces. This one was a bit better, but it still isn't my thing. Now, the ube cake is a different story. I poached a couple bites from my friend who ordered it. It wasn't overly sweet, the coconut pieces were great, and overall, I didn't expect it to be the thing I liked the most. This place is at least an hour from me, so I wouldn't drive alllll the way for this cake, but if I was having lunch nearby or had errands in the area, I would totally swing in and order one of the giant pieces. 

The people working here are super friendly, the location is a little hard to find if you don't know what you're looking for, and the inside is very clean with lots of bright color. If the seating was a bit more comfortable I could see this being a fun place to hang out.

I would categorize this place as a tourist trap which is evident as you make your way through the store to get to the restaurant. Chicken wings and spinach dip appetizer were both ok. I had mahi mahi for my main course and it was overcooked and dry. My husband had a swordfish steak, thinnest he's ever seen. Kids menu was good serving up the basics. Fish tank is cool but the dining room seemed dark as there are no windows. Sitting outside on the patio is a far better option. If you want to sit inside near the fish tank, make a reservation.
Eh- I don't get the hype.  It's a little pricey and very mediocre.  There are better choices for Mexican.

The best place in northeast Philly for great ambience, staff, food, and byob. I always bring people from out of town to The Blue Duck and everyone loves the food. I've had about everything on the menu and they are all delish. My favorite are the pierogies, burgers, and brussel sprouts.  It's best to call for reservations during the weekends.

My mom and I went on a Wednesday and got a great special on a bottle of wine. Our waiter John was very friendly and recommended the butternut squash with quinoa which was awesome. We also had the filet mignon fondue and it was delicious!! We can't wait to go back. Fun atmosphere with great live music!!

Fantastic Italian restaurant just off Wydown, a block east of Hanley. Small and quaint, the restaurant can probably only seat 30 or so people. 

But it's definitely worth your time. I enjoyed the Palermo pasta, which is a papardelle with some red sauce and both sausage and ham. DELICIOUS! The wifey had squash ravioli, and she devoured it. We were stuffed, so didn't have dessert, but I would assume it's great, based off everything else.

I have to begin this review by saying that I have never reviewed a restaurant online before but I felt it my duty to try to save someone else from the same mistake. 
 I ordered a steak sandwich with mushrooms, cheese and onion rings. My husband ordered a roast beef plate with mashed potatoes. 
1. my steak sandwich had a small piece of steak(the menu said 6 oz so I understand that). However, the steak had so much grissle(I think that's how you spell it) that I could only actually chew and swallow a few bites. 2. The mushrooms on the sandwich were cold, canned mushrooms. I'm not sure if it's a gourmet rule on cooking but I have never ordered a steak sandwich and the restaurant put canned mushrooms on it.
3. Because they put canned mushrooms on the sandwich, the piece(sandwich slice size) of cheese didn't melt so envision a grissly(sp) steak sandwich, cold watery canned mushrooms, a hard piece of unmelted cheese and bread that was twice the size of anything contained in it.
3. My onion rings( that i had to pay $2 extra for) were cold.  
My steak sandwich and onion rings came to $10.50.....RIDICULOUS
My husband fared slightly better as only his mashed potatoes were cold. His was just a smaller size plate though, no where near worth the price. He paid for it with the fact that he couldn't get them to refill his tea. 
The total cost for the 1 tea and 2 meals, $26.00. For that amount of money we could have went to several places in the area and got FAR better food. Joey b's, pasta house, affton cafe...just to name a few within a few miles. 
Also to note that because, even though it was rainy and 48 degrees, they had the door open because "it was being fixed". The man who was fixing it was chatting on the phone on the porch the whole time we tried to eat.
If the owner reads this, my suggestion to them would be, cut the menu down to a few things and make them quality food.  I suspect the lack of quality is due to trying to have too much variety.  
Save your money and go to one of the other places around.

Update!!!!  I had to try Livery again to make sure that I wasn't missing anything. Well tonight was outstanding. The corn empanadas, polenta, yuca fries were all wonderful. I'm glad that I had given them another try. Will definitely be back.

The logo already has personality: a bear with a top hat and monocle.  How is that NOT intriguing?  Go in, go in, go in!  Oh, and the bear has a top hat too!

For some reason, I didn't go for my usual vanilla frozen yogurt.  I ended up choosing the tart frozen yogurt.  Haha, do you know Yogorino?  Yeah, their frozen yogurt actually tastes like YOGURT!  Whoa, blows my mind every time.  But anyway, keeping the tart flavor in mind, I decided to have strawberries, granola, and almond slivers as toppings ;-)  Did I add chocolate syrup?  Hmm, I could have, but I don't remember.  

Anyway, how ISN'T frozen yogurt refreshing?   I don't understand why there aren't more froyo places in this neck of the suburbs.  Actually, I know of another place in East Norriton, though that's obviously not around Willow Grove.

Okay so this place is simply great. The price is just right and the food is spectacular. I had the mushroom and feta grilled cheese and I'm sitting here writing this still drooling. I opted for the tomato soup and it was mmm mmm gooood. The decor is absolutely right. The staff super friendly. Bring your family. They have multiple locations.
I am here at least once a week! It's my go to place to have quick lunch meetings or to grab a coffee with someone! Great quality and friendly staff!

I had the tuna sushi/tuna roll lunch special and it was excellent. Tuna was very fresh and rice done perfectly. Will return and try different fish next time. The green tea had an odd taste to it, almost like burning rubber. But maybe it's supposed to smell/taste like that and my American ass doesn't know any better? Great addition to the area of Springfield. Yoku yatta!

I've walked by this place many times and never stopped in. I am glad I finally got in on the calendar! 
Loved the Cuban sandwich, but the dishes friends had were great too! Fun atmosphere with Latin music! We were a group of six. It's a small place, but could accommodate a group size of 8 comfortably. 
I can't wait to bring more friends and try this place again.

Haven't been here in years, since we moved from New Orleans. I still miss it. Both NOLA and New York Pizza.

It looks like New York Pizza has moved down Magazine a few blocks to Napoleon.

We used to live about three or four blocks away on Valmont and loved their thin-crust pizza and salad with cucumbers. I can get a good imitation of thin-crust pizza from our favorite joint in Asheville, Nona Mia (the thin-crust style I like is actually called the Bronx and costs just $9), but we've tried to duplicate the dressing on the salad but can't quite do it.

Will stop in again next time we're Uptown. And while we're at it get some fresh-shucked oysters and a shrimp po-boy at Casamento's. God, I miss New Orleans.

--Lan Sluder

Come for the beer, stay for the food!!!! This is a must do on any Nashville visit. The beer is what originally made me want to visit the brewery. As a home brewer and what my wife calls "a beer snob" the beer was the main attraction. It did not disappoint. There are flavors and a variety of beers for everyone. Two that stood out were the Basil Ryeman and the Country Roots. What I did not expect was the unbelievable food. It was hands down the best burger I had ever had. The brewery is a short Uber ride from the Broadway bar scene and you need to visit. The staff are more than helpful with service and recommendations.

I finally tried out Delicia last night after seeing it being developed from the old Movie Gallery. My first impression, was that I was really impressed with the interior. They've done a remarkable job transforming a movie rental store into a classy restaurant.  The exterior is pretty much unchanged from the Movie Gallery though. 

To start, we had the salsa trio, which was good, but I found the salsa to be a bit more runny than I like, and at $8, a bit overpriced. The green salsa was by far our favorite.

For dinner, I had the tamal corn cakes. The beef on top was delicious, but I felt that the corn cake underneath was too sweet - like a very sweet cornbread, when I was expecting more of a tamale filling.

My girlfriend had the short ribs, which were good, but not mind-blowing. At $24, it just didn't quite seem to live up to expectations.

What keeps me from giving this restaurant 5 stars, is that I just didn't enjoy the food as much as I would've liked. There are a million places around in that price point, so the competition is stiff. I wouldn't mind exploring the menu a bit more though, to see if I discover any favorites, but I could take it or leave it.

I am interested in stopping by in their restaurant which is adjacent, for some less formal fare. 

We went on a Sunday night and it was maybe 20% full, so there were no worries on a wait.

I was extremely excites to brunch at this restaurant because I am an avid Top Chef fan and I am pleased to say she didn't disappoint. 

We started with the avocado and shrimp. It was a very refreshing and simple dish. For my main course I ordered the Biscuits and Gravy. It was different than the down home style that I was used to seeing presentation wise because the biscuits were served on the side, but it still gave that comfort food feel with a little bit of elevation given with the leeks in the gravy.

We went during Christmas time, so at the end of our meal we were given cute little postcards that had a recipe for a drink similar to eggnog from Ninas family recipes. It was a nice touch that made the restaurant feel more personal.

This place was good a year ago, but now it's just perfect!  Enjoy a sunset, some wine, and two orders of fish tacos while the sun sets on the pacific.  If the weather's not as good, sitting inside is nice, and there's a TV for sports.

We stopped in on our road trip. It was our first time trying Panera, as there aren't any locations in Utah. The service was excellent, and the food was great. The girl at the counter was very helpful and polite. I will definitely stop there again the next time I'm going through that area. They even have outside tables where we were able to sit with our little dog. I'm not sure what their pet policy is, but no one seemed to mind our little guy being out at the table with us. It's so nice to be able to have good food while on the road, and not have to leave our little baby i  the car.
In Tampa for a work conference and the hotel was next door. 7 of us had dinner and not one complaint! Great food, good service and nice atmosphere

Craving Greek food and couldn't decide where to  go so I consulted Yelp (obviously) and decided on the closest option. Louis Pappas. 

I entered the restaurant on a Saturday about 5-6pm. I walked past 4 employees sitting outside the front door- smoking and chatting with their feet up. I worked in restaurants for almost 10 years and that is not only disgusting it is unacceptable. I should have left right then. Instead, I stayed and ordered my food to go. I got a Greek Salad and a piece of spanakopita with a side of tzatziki. The salad was fine. Mainly shredded iceberg lettuce with a few pieces of spinach sitting on top. The spanakopita was very good and the tzatziki was decent. It was fine. I would be more tempted to go back if half the employees weren't lining the area by the front door while they enjoyed a break. 

I think I'll try another Greek place next time.

YUM!!! Every last bit was perfectly tasty. We have never been disappointed in any aspect when dining here. The service is spot on the food is always fantastic. The pre entree customary brioche is so fine with its salted butter I packed up the remainder of my dinner just so I could order another. Fine!

I Didn't really care for my meal, but I still planned to pay for it anyway. It wasn't prepared poorly, I just didn't like the taste. The waiter asked for my opinion, and I told him I didn't like it, but it just wasn't my cup of tea. I also ensured the waiter that I was still willing to pay for it. The waiter told me that they have great reviews on their food, and that if I didn't like it, I simply shouldn't order it next time instead of expecting a free meal. I again told the waiter I would pay, but he continued to tell me that they have outstanding reviews, and everyone loves their food.

I really enjoyed eating at Burger Republic! 

Their burgers were moist and juicy, and their toppings were fresh. They even had fresh avocado, which in my opinion is hard to find in Tennessee. Their fries are also crisp and golden, not soggy like some places. I also really enjoyed their beer selection as well. 

The service was quick and attentive. Our server did not forget any of what we ordered, even my side of ranch came with my plate. 

Thank you, Burger Republic! Keep up the great work!

I have not jumped on the bandwagon.  VERY overpriced for what it is.  Usually around $25 for carryout.   If you like crushed tomato on your pizza, you will give a better review.

We ahve found in restaurant is better than carry out

Went with some friends for brunch with very high expectations.  We have heard a lot of great things about this place, thus we decided to try it out. 

I ordered the lemon corncakes with fresh seasonal berries and it was subpar to say the least.  The lemon corncakes tasted so dry that I had to dunk it into the berry sauce for it to taste decent.  My boyfriend ordered the D'nai which was a slow roasted ham sandwich served with a side of their soup of the day.  I had a couple bites of his sandwich and I thought it tasted like something you can get anywhere.  Nothing outstanding.  I was surprised when they informed us that the espresso machine was not working that day, and for such a popular brunch restaurant I think that is a big no-no. 

We had to wait 20 minutes to get the coffee we ordered.  Service was spotty, granted it was brunch time on Sunday.  Certain servers there were not very pleasant.  

Needless to say, I don't think I will be back.

What great authentic German yumminess! Giant pretzel is a must...not like any other pretzel.  Sausage platter and schnitzel was classic but Goulash over egg noodles rocked the house!  Bonus was German music playing in the background....

Grilled pork spring rolls were delicious and made to order and were served with a nice peanut sauce. The pork vermicelli bowl was also good. My fiancé enjoyed her spicy beef soup, though it isn't very spicy upon service. They give you a container of chili oil for you to inflict your own punishment. They have a pho challenge, which costs $50 and you have to eat 2 pounds of meat and 2 pounds of noodles to be victorious. You don't have to consume al of the broth. According to the official wall of champions, there have been only three successful champions. Maybe you will be next?

Probably the best of the BBQ restaurants in the middle TN area but that's not saying too much.  The brisket is consistently good, but missing something (the fat cap maybe?). The ribs are always over cooked and require a fork to eat. I don't know what they put on it but it never fails to tear me up abut 15 minutes after leaving the place.  His brother Mickey Roo has just as good brisket, but also has out of this world onion rings.

Tony's makes a fabulous apple fritter.  I used to enjoy these occasionally after long morning bike rides back when I lived up in Maryland Heights.  I have yet to be able to find a comparable fritter near Webster.

After purchasing a Groupon, decided to use it today.  The service was terrible, to put it politely.  The young girl working couldn't break a smile and we had to ask for our tea after 20 min of waiting.  The food was okay but took 30+ min over the lunch hour as the other reviewers stated.  If you are looking for "ambiance", this isn't the place for you.  I like to go to places where people appreciate my business.  Will not return alone on how we were treated.   We were obviously an inconvenience to the waitress.

Quaint little cafe with amazing food! I came at 11am so I ordered lunch since their signs say breakfast ends at 11am only to find out that on Saturdays it is extended until noon. I was only disappointed in not getting breakfast, which looks amazing, but I got an equally amazing portobello and provolone sandwich. Will definitely come back again!
Always a great meal here. The Jerusalem chicken my overall favorite menu item. The salads are great and fresh.
The food portions are large, the prices are good, and the food is fantastic. A large variety of ethnic foods. AMAZING!

We were down the street and decided to stop in to buy some fresh beans for home - and we're so glad we did. The building itself is a beautiful space and seeing the roaster right in the building made us feel like our beans were extra fresh. Grabbed a couple of bags that were roasted the day before according to the date and will definitely be back. It's definitely a different feel from the Transcend next to the Garneau, but it's a nice space. Our go-to for fresh beans for sure.

My new favorite place. I've been three times already. (It's really close to my house, don't judge.) I've tried a good portion of the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. I only wish you could get the full menu for dinner as well. Drink the Pear-a-Mule, so good!!

Wow....don't know where these other reviewers ate, but not here....  3 of us had lunch, vegeburger, baja fish tacos and regular fish tacos.   Burger was terribly dry, tacos were tiny and had on little (tiny) piece of fish that was hidden under a bunch of cabbage.  Smallest $9.25 tacos possible and total fish weight could  not have been 2 oz.  Cute place, but very poor value

We had high expectations for this place and it was just OK in comparison to all the great NYC or Chicago restaurants out there. 

Table of three ordered the following: 
1. Arancini - interesting twist with the citrus sauce 
2. Croquettes- awesome 
3. Steak Tartare- it was ok; nothing to write home about
4. Oysters- small oysters full of flavor 
5. Curried goat- disappointing; there's was barely any curry in the dish; least favorite dish of the night 
6. Shrimp and clam pasta- nicely done pasta but salty AF. 
7. Trio pork- pork belly was delicious

Best coffee atmosphere and great coffee!  Their sausage biscuits are great too! The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because some of the employees are a bit rude and act a bit too "cool" to wait on you. Other than that great place!

Very yummy and inexpensive. Had the Italian Veggie Rice bowl and an O'fallon IPA. My companion had the Salmon Panin and the soup special, which was veggie potato, and really enjoyed it.  The best part of the menu is the fact that you get to mix and match ingredients, so the possibilities are endless. We splint a cinnamon banana smoothie for dessert.

There was a group using the space for a meeting, looks great for that as well!

Support your local neighborhood food joints!
The best in town, Good Food, Good Service....Affordable Price too..highly recommended, they have some especial promo too.........

There is not much I really need to say about Trident Grill except HOLY MAC N' CHEESE!!! Order it with a side of the death wing sauce and oh em gee...YUM! Ok and maybe one more thing...this place screams local, friendly and fun. Exactly what I would expect from a bar with personalized beer stein's for regulars. Love it!
I came here with a group of friends who have a variety of dietary restrictions. The staff were very accommodating in modifying dishes, and the service  was quick. The food tasted amazing as well!
Food is good, the burgers were pretty tasty, my girlfriend and I both really enjoyed what we got. The beer menu was a bit lacking, could use more variety.

Came here for my wife's birthday mainly for the views, which were absolutely incredible! To be honest I had heard that the food here wasn't great but I didn't mind because I was going for the atmosphere...

HOWEVER - The food was five star quality, really really good. That's coming from somebody who enjoys quality food. A+

Fulton Alley is "boutique bowling" at its finest. If you are one who likes to actually bowl, this may not be the place for you. Food is good (chicken wings are excellent, setting is beautiful and service was above average. We were surprised by the pins being suspended on strings...it was a very different experience and seemed like you were not really bowling. Negatives, which were paramount.... It is pricey and you cannot finish a game if you exceed your time, which is sold in 30 minute increments. Will we go back? Probably, due to the location and because we like to bowl....but we will get additional lanes so that we can complete games that are started. Fun addition to our great city, but get ready to spend $$$
Nice cozy place with a decent beet and wine selection.  Definately interested in coming back to the place, and as a completely strange compliment the counter tops rock.
The food was a bit messy but still was great. One of my favorite chilli dogs ever, and the shakes were awesome! They didn't give enough napkins, but they still have great food!

Pretty good menu. Lots of items for all to choose from. 

They even do breakfast all day if you like that. The kids like the pancakes. 

I go for the Ruben or the pastrami. It's pretty good. 

They have been known to have live entertainment from time to time as well

They have great nightlife here compared to all the hotels in the area. On a Thursday night they had an outside stage with live music of mostly country and right near beach access with a bar and deck. They also have a proper nightclub that plays hip-hop and an electronic music. Both are setup fairly nicely.

Typical tourist restaurant with a limited menu. Although it sits Waterside on the inter coastal of St Pet's John's Pass, it's obvious the waitress tries not to give away that it's not all that!

I ordered  very bland Pina Colada, which was quickly replaced with a beer.
The meal was well..... bland as well. A French Dip that should come with cheese, is additional  $2.00 up charge. I ordered shrimp stuffed with crab. Not great but $24.00 I received 6 with a spoon full of frozen vegetables.

Not even gonna think about a second visit.  The waitress melissa was really friendly and helped alot.
We sat outside instead of inside,which after going into the restroom, I'm glad we did. 
The inside smiled old. The restroom was cramped,out dated.  The walls were missing tiles with a sign that asked you to hold down the handled

My sister and I stumbled across the town of Dunedin and Kelly's Chicka Boom.  We stopped for lunch. We both ordered the shrimp bisque, which was the daily soup special.  I think we both licked the bowl it was so so good. My sister ordered wings. I don't normally care for wings but these were the tenderest wings I've ever had and delicious.  I also ordered the Brussels sprout appetizer.  It needs a dipping sauce. I used sriracha and I was fine.  They were also delicious. It was so good we went back for dinner.  We split the steak sandwich.  It was enough for us to split...probably not to split with my hubbie though.  Also really good. Would order any or all of it again on a different trip.

Super friendly staff and crowd.  Great outdoor back patio with music.
Great pizza, salad and customer service! Definitely coming back for more. Pretty much a Subway for pizza.
I'm not really a sushi person. But this place really had good food. Brand new and nice staff.

There are two occasions when my wife and I go to Brios.  On a Saturday date night after seeing a movie at Frontenac Plaza.  And on Sunday early evenings when we want to take the family out to some place a bit more upscale.  We like the atmosphere, we like the food and the service has always been stellar.  The noise level depends on when you go.  We tend to go on the early or late side of dinner.  Our favorite item on the menu is the Shrimp Mediterranean.

The scallops dinner is wonderful. The scallops were in an excellent sauce and were delicious. The coconut pineapple rice was amazingly good. My wife had the shrimp and corn chowder and was very happy with it and her crab cakes. Excellent food and a very good value for a quality dining experience. This is now my go to place to take friends and family.
Outstanding! Definitely will come back the next time I am in Reno! I would recommend the ceviche, the Cuban and the homemade ginger ale. Service is good and we got to meet the owner before we left.

Street Taco is my go to place for tacos in all of Tucson. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the inside reminds me of chipotle but the food is 100000x better then chipotle. Their carne Asada, al pastor, and fish tacos are my favorite. Get them "Street style" with onions and cilantro. Love their $1 side of Mexican rice and their guac is pretty good too! Free help ur self chips and salsa!!! The best. Their green avocado based medium salsa is sooooo good, I want to steal their recipe.

Long wait, but it was packed in there (Thursday morning around 9:30 AM). All the staff members are SUPER nice. They def have the best bowl of grits in the whole damn city. I got the Garden omelette, which has spinach, onion, and tomatoes, and I substituted egg whites for an extra $1. So for $7.95 I got an egg white omelette, toast, and a huge bowl of grits. Add a $2.50 cup of single americano and you have a reasonably priced, delicious, healthy breakfast :-) My friend got some sort of pesto goat cheese avocado croissant concoction which looked divine...Refuel wins

Too bad you can't rate no stars on Yelp. The hostess was a jerk. We walked into the entrance, 3 adults and 2 children, awaiting someone to greet us and seat us. We asked if we could seat ourselves and she told us "no, do not stand here, you are blocking our way; go outside and I will come seat you." In an extremely rude tone. It was 45 degrees out and raining. We walked out and took our $200 tab elsewhere.
Best place to relax on the patio and have some healthy food. Tutu's Berry Banana Smoothie and T's Cranberry Spinach Salad with chicken, feta cheese and Avocado.

Decent food and a great place to meet up with little ones in tow. The atmosphere is super relaxed (picnic type) and is generally very busy on the weekends. Kids like the open play area with sand pits, the train near by, and freedom to run around in a safe environment.

Came here for the first time last week -- excellent food for a brewery; my vegetarian friend was completely satisfied with the menu options. Great beer too -- I've had the Blonde many times I've visited Arizona -- my only (small) gripe is the lack of beer descriptions anywhere (no printed list, and the chalkboard tap list doesn't elaborate). The bar was slammed, and it would've been nice to try something new without having to slow service down for everyone by asking what exactly is a "NCAAle" when it could've just been written down somewhere. That said, great place overall, and I'd definitely return.

This was the final meal on our trip.  It was pretty darn good.  A couple of things lacking but overall it was still awesome!  They have a Thursday special which is any large cheesesteak and a milkshake for $10.50.  I got a whiz with and a vanilla shake.

Cheesesteak-  They use really good meat here.  Its not all hacked up into pieces yet its not perfectly round slices of steak.  Kind of like a hybrid.  The meat was really good.  They load this thing up with a lot of onions too which I like.  The only thing I would change is the whiz.  It wasn't ooey and gooey...maybe it wasn't melted/heated enough???  Something was a little off with it.  The bread was good but a little too doughy.  Still a really good sandwich though.  If I ever go back, I'm going to order it with American cheese. (I read that American used to be the only way you could get a Chinks steak).

Milkshake-  Delicious!  Plain vanilla.  I believe they use Turkey Hill Ice Cream which is phenomenal.  Some of the best ice cream you can get!  You could taste the vanilla bean and it was blended perfectly so you could suck it through the straw without straining too hard.  A great milkshake!

Service-  The service was amazing!  The waitress was super friendly and very "easy on the eyes".  She got my buddy drink refills without asking and delivered us more napkins when she saw we had cheese running down our face...very attentive!

Out of 4 cheesesteaks on our trip, this would rank number 2 probably behind Steves Prince of Steaks.  I wouldn't recommend the whiz though.  Go with American and it would probably be a 5 star joint!  Total for 2 steaks, a Coke and a Milkshake was $22 and change.

3 stars for the food and an extra one for the service!

If I could give this place zero stars I would. The sushi is not worth the money, too fishy so it's obviously not fresh. And no this is not the first time I've felt this way about this place. I have given Sushi Nara many tries, and they are always mediocre or horrible. The experience, service, and food are lackluster. Don't waste your time or money.

As a NJ Diner, it deserves a 5 Star Rating - but now when compared to 5 star restaurants! Great place with some really good food. Omelets are huge and very tasty. Homemade chili is a must. Try it. I am sure you will not be disappointed.

What an awesome experience. We arrived at around 9 on Presidents' Day and were seated in about 10 minutes. As we waited we got the bottomless drip, which was very tasty. They offer honey and other regular mix-ins for  your coffee, but I prefer mine black. We also got a sticky pecan bun. I highly recommend this to anyone. It is so doughy and sweet!!!!
